comment: Decent bottle something simple to drink.

[09.27.16] After the bourbon bracket shenanigans of 2014, I can't believe I never put a note in about this. Bracket winner that fall (over Crow, Dan Tucker and OYO, etc.), this is a fine whiskey with adequate barrel tang/spice. A bit mild but worth a try, especially if like me you find this under $30.
Mild sipper with notes of smokey vanilla and caramel. Mild aroma with light aftertaste. This is a good cigar bourbon as it doesn't overwhelm the palette.
Very smooth caramel taste. Great finish
Bought at local liquor store. Good mixer, has a bit of spice. Drink over ice.
Easy to drink as the taste is not overwhelming.
Just OK. Not a fan of whiskey with strong oily notes. The Rye is much better in my opinion. Enjoyed neat.
Very smooth and smokey, not very flavorful though.  Budget friendly. Would get again.
For the price it's not bad. It's a little sweeter than I like and it makes for an odd mixer, but I'd definitely go back to it.

The palette was pretty mild and I was trying to pick out notes when spice kicked in. After swallowing the spice turned to burn which I felt  all the way down to my stomach. Not unpleasant but not enjoyable. Subsequent sips and I started detecting a honey flavor and sweetness.

This bourbon tastes like bananas...B-A-N-A-N-A-S.  Raw, sweet, pretty much a mixer.  I thing the yeast in my batch must have been screwed up.  For 99 cents I can get 3 lbs of bananas at the store and save the whiskey expense.


One star for the bourbon, one for the banana flavor.
Not a fan. Raw and too sharp with not a good finish.
On the nose we have sweet corn, Carmel and a slight alcohol bite. Smooth and sweet on the palate. Quick finish. A very young bourbon and it drinks as such. Nothing special.
I absolutely hated this at first. Grew to enjoy it out of boredom. Don't buy again.
Straight up corn. 2. I’d mix drinks with it

For a bourbon, immensily fruity on the nose and the palate. Beautiful banana, honeydew, strawberries. 
Easy sipping.
Fairly priced for quality.
Mellow and smooth. A small hint of char from the barrels but very balanced. Hints of honey and buttercream. Delicious.
The bottle is amazing. What’s inside, not as much. Drinkable, but that’s all.
Ok. Nothing to write home about
Smokey, hint of chocolate at the end. Somewhat harsh
Young, light and thin, fruity, some banana I get  mangoes on the finish. $35, nope I’ll take an ancient ancient age for $15 every time over this.
First Bourbon in over five years, so palate is beginners at best.  I enjoyed it.
Not a hateful bourbon but the malt is strong on this one. Maybe if you're in the mood for a decent Scotch but want to pay bourbon prices, go for this and compromise.

I have allowed this bottle to sit for about a year after opening.  The initial banana flavor is still present, but not overpowering.  The bourbon now has a focused expression of brown sugar, honey and light bananas.  It tastes like banana bread.
beautiful taste. best I've had at this price range

When tasted neat: Smooth through the whole tasting. Really no heat or any spice with this which seems lacking. I definitely sensed the woody/oak aromas with a slight bit of cherry/sugar smooth finish. When tasted on rocks: about the same, very smooth flavorful but could use a little more kick to increase the complexity. I would purchase again just because it was a good price and overall was an enjoyable bourbon.
Lots of cinnamon kind of watery
High corn, has a lot of the same notes as Watershed. Distinct flavor compared to most bourbons (tried in Bardstown)
Smells like Scotch. Tastes like Scotch with a cherry kick. 4/11/19

This stuff is weird. It tastes barrel finished in white wine. It tastes like a mix of cough syrup, white grape juice, and a splash of bourbon. It’s not offensive, but tastes unlike anything I have had. Try before you buy. Not my cup of tea.
The only time I opened a bottle and poured it away. I hated it....Didn't even manage it when drowned in Mixer

Smell: maple
Initial: brown sugar
Middle: Carmel
End: Sweet!
One star just because it will get you drunk. Overpriced and underperforming.
They should lower the price $10, put this in plastic bottles and market this to college kids. Not for me
Taste more like scotch than it does bourbon
Wonderful sweet and floral nose, finishes spicy and warm.
Has that young corn or smoke or hay/grass note that I hate.

Some sentimental factors, but low key this is a fantastic, cheap bourbon.  Oak tobacco and apple on the nose.  Very smooth, tastes about like it smells; medium sweetness; unctuous texture.  Oak and faint licorice aftertaste
not much on the nose.  tastes light.  generally smooth.  the bourbon flavor comes as more of an after taste.  reminds me of a better version of the Minnesota whiskey.
